definition: Kai-Fu Lee (1961-), Taiwanese computer scientist and IT executive, founding president of Google China 2005-2009

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

sentences.english: Young Chinese follow Kaifu Lee`s every move.
sentences.chinese: 李開復，中國的年輕人對其一舉一動都趨之若鶩。

sentences.english: Former VP of Google, Kai-Fu Lee is an icon of success in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，前谷歌副總裁，李開復，是成功的典範。

sentences.english: In 2005, the prosecution of Microsoft on Google hired away Kai-fu Lee.
sentences.chinese: 2005年，微軟就起訴谷歌挖走了李開復。

sentences.english: Lee was perhaps the most famous of all sea turtles.
sentences.chinese: 李開復或許是所有海龜中最知名的一位。

sentences.english: The company successfully poached Microsoft Vice President Kai-Fu Lee to run its Chinese business.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌成功地將微軟副總裁李開復挖過來負責中國業務。

sentences.english: At first, when Kai-Fu Lee was incharge of Google China, it worked fine. Google China could follow the cadence.
sentences.chinese: 一開始李開復在谷歌中國的時候，還算正常。

sentences.english: When she was called to Kai-Fu Lee's office for dismissal, she was dumbfounded.
sentences.chinese: 當李開復叫她到辦公室說開除一事，她目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: Dr. Lee’s decision — and his timing — provided instant fuel for China’s entrepreneurial fire.
sentences.chinese: 李開復的決定和規劃燎燃了中國大地上的創業之火。

sentences.english: The trouble is there’s a dearth of angel capital and early stage coaching, Lee says.
sentences.chinese: 李開復認爲問題在於中國缺乏天使投資和早期指導。

pinyin: zi4 ran2 yu3 yan2 chu3 li3

definition: hard power (i.e. military and economic power)

pinyin: Guang3 dong1 Wai4 yu3 Wai4 mao4 Da4 xue2
